intro: Adenoropium opiferum, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces showy, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields. Adenoropium opiferum is also known for its ability to spread rapidly, making it an invasive species in some regions.
